generic.genobj

generic.genobj Class Reference

class for building binary targets like programs, shared libraries, static libs, loadable modules and convenience libraries More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

def setsource
 list of source files target name flags for c++ compiler (may be platform dependent) flags for c compiler (may be platform dependent) additional include path(es) (using '/' on every platform) flags for linker (may be platform dependent) list of path(es) containing required libraries (use with libs class member) list of libraries which should be included in this binary object use the basic library name without any platform specific prefix or suffixes on linux e.g. use of bksys predefined module/libraries found in the configure part This will add all required c/c++ and linker flags often used modules are QT QTCORE QT3SUPPORT KDE4 FAM ART PCRE XML OPENSSL library prefix this value will be added at the beginning of the binary object target name on linux e.g if the target is named xyaz and libprefix is set to 'lib' the real library is named libxyz a directory where to install the targets (optional) unix permissions
def joinpath
def fixpath
 FIXME : this scheme is ugly (ita) a list of paths, with absolute and relative ones, useful when giving include dirs If a path begins with ##, then its corresponding build dir will be added as well.
def lockworkdir
def unlockworkdir
def execute

Detailed Description

class for building binary targets like programs, shared libraries, static libs, loadable modules and convenience libraries

def generic.genobj.fixpath (    self,
  val
) 
 

FIXME : this scheme is ugly (ita) a list of paths, with absolute and relative ones, useful when giving include dirs If a path begins with ##, then its corresponding build dir will be added as well.

Definition at line 246 of file generic.py.

def generic.genobj.setsource (    self,
  src
) 
 

list of source files target name flags for c++ compiler (may be platform dependent) flags for c compiler (may be platform dependent) additional include path(es) (using '/' on every platform) flags for linker (may be platform dependent) list of path(es) containing required libraries (use with libs class member) list of libraries which should be included in this binary object use the basic library name without any platform specific prefix or suffixes on linux e.g. use of bksys predefined module/libraries found in the configure part This will add all required c/c++ and linker flags often used modules are QT QTCORE QT3SUPPORT KDE4 FAM ART PCRE XML OPENSSL library prefix this value will be added at the beginning of the binary object target name on linux e.g if the target is named xyaz and libprefix is set to 'lib' the real library is named libxyz a directory where to install the targets (optional) unix permissions

use xyz for the real library named libxyz.so
